dir=\"auto\"\u003eThis plugin exports several recommended configurations that enforce good practices for specific Testing Library packages.\nYou can find more info about enabled rules in the \u003ca href=\"#supported-rules\"\u003eSupported Rules section\u003c/a\u003e, under the \u003ccode\u003eConfigurations\u003c/code\u003e column.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSince each one of these configurations is aimed at a particular Testing Library package, they are not extendable between them, so you should use only one of them at once per \u003ccode\u003e.eslintrc\u003c/code\u003e file. data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="module.exports = {plugins: ['testing-library'],};"><pre><span class="pl-smi">module</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">exports</span> <span {'testing-library/await-async-queries': 'error','testing-library/no-await-sync-queries': 'error','testing-library/no-debugging-utils': 'warn','testing-library/no-dom-import': 'off',},};"><pre><span <code>overrides</code></h4><a id="user-content-eslint-overrides" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: ESLint overrides" href="#eslint-overrides"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">One way of restricting ESLint config by file patterns is by using <a href="https://eslint.org/docs/user-guide/configuring/configuration-files#configuration-based-on-glob-patterns" rel="nofollow">ESLint <code>overrides</code></a>.</p><p dir="auto">Assuming you are using the same pattern for your test files as <a href="https://jestjs.io/docs/configuration#testmatch-arraystring" rel="nofollow">Jest by default</a>, the following config would run <code>eslint-plugin-testing-library</code> only against your test files:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="// .eslintrc.jsmodule.exports = {// 1) Here we have our usual config which applies to the whole project, so we don't put testing-library preset here.extends: ['airbnb', 'plugin:prettier/recommended'],// 2) We load other plugins than eslint-plugin-testing-library globally if we want to.plugins: ['react-hooks'],overrides: [{// 3) Now we enable eslint-plugin-testing-library rules or preset only for matching testing files!files: ['**/__tests__/**/*.[jt]s?(x)', '**/?(*.)+(spec|test).[jt]s?(x)'],extends: ['plugin:testing-library/react'],},],};"><pre><span class="pl-c">// .eslintrc.js</span><span class="pl-smi">module</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">exports</span> <span <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">'react-hooks'</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-c1">overrides</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Another approach for customizing ESLint config by paths is through <a href="https://eslint.org/docs/user-guide/configuring/configuration-files#cascading-and-hierarchy" rel="nofollow">ESLint Cascading and Hierarchy</a>. This is useful if all your tests are placed under the same folder, so you can place there another <code>.eslintrc</code> where you enable <code>eslint-plugin-testing-library</code> for applying it only to the files under such folder, rather than enabling it on your global <code>.eslintrc</code> which would apply to your whole project.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Shareable configurations</h2><a id="user-content-shareable-configurations" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Shareable configurations" href="#shareable-configurations"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This plugin exports several recommended configurations that enforce good practices for specific Testing Library packages.You can find more info about enabled rules in the <a href="#supported-rules">Supported Rules section</a>, under the <code>Configurations</code> column.</p><p dir="auto">Since each one of these configurations is aimed at a particular Testing Library package, they are not extendable between them, so you should use only one of them at once per <code>.eslintrc</code> file. For example, if you want to enable recommended configuration for React, you don't need to combine it somehow with DOM one:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative directly from a Testing Library package (i.e. <a href="https://testing-library.com/docs/react-testing-library/setup/#custom-render" rel="nofollow">using a custom utility file to re-export everything from Testing Library</a>). You can <a href="/testing-library/eslint-plugin-testing-library/blob/main/docs/migration-guides/v4.md#aggressive-reporting">read more about this feature here</a>.</p><p dir="auto">If you are looking to restricting or switching off this feature, please refer to the <a href="#shared-settings">Shared Settings section</a> to do so.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Shared Settings</h2><a id="user-content-shared-settings" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Shared Settings" href="#shared-settings"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">There are some configuration options available that will be shared across all the plugin rules. This is achieved using <a href="https://eslint.org/docs/user-guide/configuring/configuration-files#adding-shared-settings" rel="nofollow">ESLint Shared Settings</a>. These Shared Settings are meant to be used if you need to restrict or switch off the Aggressive Reporting, which is an out of the box advanced feature to lint Testing Library usages in a simpler way for most of the users. <strong>So please before configuring any of these settings</strong>, read more about <a href="/testing-library/eslint-plugin-testing-library/blob/main/docs/migration-guides/v4.md#aggressive-reporting">the advantages of <code>eslint-plugin-testing-library</code> Aggressive Reporting feature</a>, and <a href="/testing-library/eslint-plugin-testing-library/blob/main/docs/migration-guides/v4.md#shared-settings">how it's affected by these settings</a>.</p><p dir="auto">If you are sure about configuring the settings, these are the options available:</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><code>testing-library/utils-module</code></h3><a id="user-content-testing-libraryutils-module" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: testing-library/utils-module" href="#testing-libraryutils-module"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The name of your custom utility file from where you re-export everything from the Testing Library package, or <code>"off"</code> to switch related Aggressive Reporting mechanism off.
